#Apple Mobility Data analysis

## Setup 

This report will use dplyr [@dplyr], ggplot2 [@ggplot2], readr [@readr], and 
tidyr [@tidyr]

```{r load in libaries}
# load library
library("dplyr")
library("readr")
library("tidyr")
library("ggplot2")
```

```{r Source functions}
# Source Functions
source("code/functions/subset_mobility_data.R")
source("code/functions/make_data_longer.R")
```

```{r for loop for analysis}
# state_to_subset <- "New York"

for (state_to_subset in c("California")) {
  
  # Subsetting of data
  subsetted <- subset_mobility_data("data/raw_data/applemobilitytrends-2022-04-12.csv",
                       state_to_subset)
  
  # Make data longer
  make_data_long(subsetted)
}
```
